alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 13 at 10:27AM MST until December 15 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest to Northwest winds 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Wind of this magnitude may down trees, power lines, and damage property. High winds may also create dangerous travel conditions, especially on high speed limit, high traffic routes such as Interstate 70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This system will not develop until early Wednesday morning and, when it does develop, it will do so very near or directly over the Tri-State area. As a result, a fair amount of uncertainty persists with regard to both the magnitude and location of the strongest winds. Hurricane force wind gusts are possible.
info.instruction: Secure outdoor holiday decorations and other loose or light weight objects. Travelers are urged to prepare for difficult driving conditions on Wednesday. Stay tuned for later forecasts and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
